Class OrderDAO

java.lang.Object
users.OrderDAO
public class OrderDAO extends Object
OrderDAO is a Data Access Object (DAO) class that provides methods for managing Order records in an SQLite database. This class includes operations for adding orders, initialising the database table, and ensuring data integrity through foreign key relationships with the `users` table.
Version:
5/1/2025
Author:
Amrit Singh

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderDAO

      public OrderDAO()
      Default constructor for OrderDAO. Initialises a new instance of the class without any additional setup.

  • Method Details

    • addOrder

      public boolean addOrder(Order order)
      Adds a new order to the database. The order must have a valid `user` object with an associated `userId`. If the creation is successful, the `orderId` of the provided Order object is updated with the generated ID from the database.
      Parameters:
      order - the Order object containing order details
      Returns:
      true if the order was successfully added, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the `user` in the order is null

    • getOrdersByUserId

      public List<Order> getOrdersByUserId(int userId)
      Retrieves a list of orders associated with a specific user ID. This method queries the `orders` table in the database to fetch all orders placed by the specified user. Each order includes details such as the order ID, total price, and the timestamp when the order was created.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose orders are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a list of `Order` objects associated with the user; an empty list if no orders are found or an error occurs
